6.title: LabIMotion 1.3.0 is here! ü•Å
6.content: LabIMotion 1.3.0 brings new features including Generic Element Reporting, Split Function, and Export/Import Collection capabilities. Claire Lin¬∑April 26, 2024 . The open source LabIMotion project just released LabIMotion 1.3.0 with features and bug fixes.

7.title: Highlights from LabIMotion 1.3.0
7.content: To celebrate this most recent release, here are the key features introduced in this release: . | As a User . | Generic Element Reporting Function (doc) | Generic Element Split Function (doc) | Export/Import Collection function (doc) | . | As a Designer . | Restriction Setting (doc) | System Units and Customize Default Unit for Field (doc) | . | . For more detailed information, please refer to the release notes for 1.3.0. Stay up-to-date with the latest developments by subscribing to our mailing list to receive the latest updates. Categories:   Announcements Releases . Subscribe & Share Feedback . Get the latest development updates, tips, and best practices, or share your feedback with us. Subscribe Email Us

9.title: Preview Start! Join the Chemotion LabIMotion 1.4.0 Preview! üëÄ
9.content: Join the preview of Chemotion LabIMotion 1.4.0 and explore exciting new features including image previews, custom labeling, and interactive workflows. Claire Lin¬∑June 04, 2024 . Dear Chemotion LabIMotion users, . We are thrilled to announce the upcoming release of Chemotion LabIMotion version 1.4.0! To ensure this version meets your needs and expectations, we invite you to participate in our preview program. This is your chance to explore the new features and provide invaluable feedback. What‚Äôs New in v1.4.0: . | üñºÔ∏è Preview Image Function for the ‚ÄúUpload‚Äù Field Type: Get an image preview as soon as you upload a file. You can zoom in/out by adjusting the percentage, and open the original file with a single click. | üè∑Ô∏è Labeling Feature: Enhance your organization and categorization with custom labels. This feature improves searchability and overall management within the system. | ‚û°Ô∏è Drag Reactions to Elements: Experience a more interactive and intuitive interface by dragging and dropping reactions onto elements. The Export/Import Collection and Reporting functions will now include reaction data as well. | üîÑ Change Layer or Field Order via Drag-and-Drop: Enjoy greater flexibility in managing your data by simply dragging and dropping layers or fields into your desired order. | üñåÔ∏è Custom Flow: Enables users to record their steps/work and visualize them as a flow diagram. | . All details and videos are available at here. We encourage you to try out these features in our test instance and share your feedback or observations. Your insights are crucial for refining these features before the final release. How to Participate: . | üñ•Ô∏è Visit the Test Instance: Link to Test Instance | üîç Explore the New Features: Dive into the new functionalities and see how they enhance your workflow. | üí¨ Provide Feedback: Share your thoughts and observations in our discussion thread Link to Discussion Thread. | . We appreciate your participation and look forward to your feedback. Thank you! . Categories:   Announcements Preview . Subscribe & Share Feedback . Get the latest development updates, tips, and best practices, or share your feedback with us. Subscribe Email Us

15.title: Chemotion LabIMotion 2.0.0 Preview Start!
15.content: This is a significant milestone for LabIMotion as we are upgrading to the latest version of react-bootstrap, the main library for UI components. We have also introduced new features to enhance the user experience. Claire Lin¬∑December 06, 2024 . Dear Chemotion LabIMotion users, . Welcome to the preview for Chemotion LabIMotion 2.0.0! . This is a major milestone for LabIMotion as we are upgrading to the latest version of react-bootstrap, which is the main library for UI components. This upgrade brings us a more modern and feature-rich UI experience. With the new version of react-bootstrap and feedback from the community, we‚Äôve also introduced new features to enhance the user experience. Let‚Äôs jump into the details! .

16.title: Introducing the new UI experience
16.content: Designer‚Äôs New Form Layout . Based on community feedback, we have redesigned the form layout with a more general style to make it easier for users to get started. (Click to view in a new window ) . Arranging the order . Drag-and-drop is a highly interactive and user-friendly feature. We use drag-and-drop to perform reordering layers or fields for Designer, and the similar feature for User to rearrange the layers in the workspace. Reordering is great, but it‚Äôs even better if the user can compare the original order at the same time. Therefore, we have provided a dedicated feature for ordering that allows you to visually compare the original order and the new order. (Click to view in a new window ) . Your browser does not support the video tag. As a Designer, you can find functions to reorder layers or fields accordingly. (Click to view in a new window ) . In user workspace (aka MyDB), you can find a button called Arrange on the toolbar and use it to rearrange layers. (Click to view in a new window ) .

17.title: Workflow for Segment
17.content: In this version, we have introduced the workflow functionality to Segment. As a Designer, you can define a workflow in Segment template just like in Element template. For more details about the workflow feature, please refer to the Designer Guide. (Click to view in a new window ) . When you use a Segment that contains a predefined workflow, the workflow is automatically applied to the Segment and you can click the Workflow (Predefined) button to view the defined workflow. (Click to view in a new window ) .

18.title: Vocabularies and Standard Layers Updates
18.content: In the initial release of the LabIMotion Vocabulary (Lab-Vocab) and Standard Layer, the data size were relatively small. Developing uniform, predefined, reusable, ontology-related sets of fields and layouts is a complex task that relies on domain expertise. We are grateful to the community for their invaluable contributions, which allow us to continuously enhance this data. (Click to view in a new window ) . (Click to view in a new window ) . Your browser does not support the video tag. How to Participate in the Preview . | üñ•Ô∏è Visit the Test Instance: Link to Test Instance | üîç Explore the New Features: Dive into the new functionalities and see how they enhance your workflow. | ‚ù§Ô∏è Provide Feedback: For the feedback of this preview, please share your thoughts and observations in our discussion thread Link to Discussion Thread. | . We appreciate your participation and look forward to your feedback. Thank you! . Categories:   Announcements Preview . Subscribe & Share Feedback . Get the latest development updates, tips, and best practices, or share your feedback with us. Subscribe Email Us

22.title: üéâ Release Chemotion LabIMotion 2.0.0!
22.content: This changelog allows you to identify specific versions that contain feature requests or bug fixes. Claire Lin¬∑March 25, 2025 . We are delighted to announce the release of LabIMotion 2.0.0, packed with cool features and improvements! . Here are a few highlights in the 2.0.0: . | New UI for Designer | New Field Type: Select (Multiple) introduced in Designer | Quick Filter for Designer ‚Äì Easily locate templates containing specific keywords | New Supported Units - See the full list at Supported Units for System Defined Field | Collapse/Expand All Layers** ‚Äì A single-click feature to toggle all layers | Vocabularies and Standard Layers | . The planned 1.5.0 release was postponed due to dependencies in a consuming project. All updates from 1.5.0 are included in 2.0.0, along with additional features and a breaking change. Bug fixes and various improvements are also included. A more detailed list can be found at Release 2.0.0. To learn more about LabIMotion 2.0.0, check out: . | Version 2.0.0 Public Preview. | Version 1.5.0 Public Preview | . Categories:   Announcements Releases . Subscribe & Share Feedback . Get the latest development updates, tips, and best practices, or share your feedback with us. Subscribe Email Us

29.title: Dataset Schema
29.content: A standardized set of metadata properties used to describe Datasets in LabIMotion. View JSON Schema View on GitHub .

30.title: Overview
30.content: The Dataset Schema provides a contract for the JSON data used in LabIMotion datasets, detailing what properties the JSON data should have, their types, and additional constraints.

31.title: Schema Structure
31.content: { "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#", "$id": "https://labimotion.github.io/schema/v1.0/sch-dataset.json", "type": "object", "allOf": [ { "$ref": "./include/sch-common-properties.json" }, { "properties": { "layers": { "$ref": "./include/sch-layers.json", "description": "Layers to be used for dataset." }, "select_options": { "$ref": "./include/sch-select-options.json", "description": "Select options for dataset." } } } ] } .

32.title: Properties
32.content: Common Properties . All Dataset objects must include these common properties: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | pkg | Object | Yes | Package information including ELN version | . | uuid | String | Yes | Unique identifier | . | klass | String | Yes | Must be ‚ÄúDatasetKlass‚Äù | . Layer Properties . Datasets can have multiple layers, each containing: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | key | String | Yes | Layer identifier | . | cols | Integer | Yes | Number of columns | . | position | Integer | Yes | Layer position | . | fields | Array | No | Array of fields | . | color | String | No | Background color of the layer header | . | label | String | No | Label of the layer | . Select Options . Optional select options for dropdown fields: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | desc | String | Yes | Description of the option | . | options | Array | Yes | Array of key-value pairs | .

34.title: Related Schemas
34.content: . | Common Properties Schema | Layers Schema | Select Options Schema | .

35.title: Version History
35.content: Version 1.0 (Current) . | Released: January 31, 2024 | Initial release with basic dataset structure | Layer support | Select options support | .

36.title: Feedback
36.content: We appreciate your feedback regarding any challenges you may be facing with the current schema or any ideas you have for improvements. Email Us GitHub .

37.title: Element Schema
37.content: A standardized set of metadata properties used to describe Elements in LabIMotion. View JSON Schema View on GitHub .

38.title: Overview
38.content: The Element Schema provides a contract for the JSON data used in LabIMotion elements, detailing what properties the JSON data should have, their types, and additional constraints.

40.title: Properties
40.content: Common Properties . All Element objects must include these common properties: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | pkg | Object | Yes | Package information including ELN version | . | uuid | String | Yes | Unique identifier | . | klass | String | Yes | Must be ‚ÄúElementKlass‚Äù | . Layer Properties . Elements can have multiple layers, each containing: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | key | String | Yes | Layer identifier | . | cols | Integer | Yes | Number of columns | . | position | Integer | Yes | Layer position | . | fields | Array | No | Array of fields | . | color | String | No | Background color of the layer header | . | label | String | No | Label of the layer | .

43.title: Version History
43.content: Version 1.0 (Current) . | Released: January 31, 2024 | Initial release with basic element structure | Layer support | Field definitions | .

44.title: Feedback
44.content: We appreciate your feedback regarding any challenges you may be facing with the current schema or any ideas you have for improvements. Email Us GitHub .

45.title: LabIMotion Schemas
45.content: Documentation for all available LabIMotion JSON Schemas.

46.title: Available Schemas
46.content: Core Schemas . | Schema | Description | Version | . | Element Schema | Defines the structure for elements | 1.0 | . | Segment Schema | Defines the structure for segments | 1.0 | . | Dataset Schema | Defines the structure for datasets | 1.0 | . Supporting Schemas . | Schema | Description | . | Common Properties | Base properties used across all schemas | . | Layers | Layer structure definition | . | Fields | Field type definitions | .

47.title: Schema Versioning
47.content: The current stable version is 1.0. All schemas follow semantic versioning: . | Major version changes (1.0 ‚Üí 2.0) indicate breaking changes | Minor version changes (1.0 ‚Üí 1.1) indicate new features | Patch version changes (1.0.0 ‚Üí 1.0.1) indicate bug fixes | .

48.title: Using the Schemas
48.content: Direct References . You can reference the schemas directly in your JSON: . { "$schema": "https://labimotion.github.io/schema/v1.0/sch-element.json" } .

49.title: Contributing
49.content: We welcome contributions! Please see our contribution guidelines for more information.

52.title: Overview
52.content: The Development Guide provides documentation for working with LabIMotion templates and schemas. This guide will help you understand the structure and capabilities of LabIMotion.

53.title: Getting Started
53.content: . | Understanding Templates . | Templates are JSON files that define the structure of your laboratory data | Each template follows a specific schema (Element, Segment, or Dataset) | Templates can be customized with various field types and layouts | . | Basic Components . | Element Schema: A generic element with layers and fields | Segment Schema: Groups related data together for a single element | Dataset Schema: A dataset based on the ontology terminology | . | Template Structure . | Each template consists of layers | Layers contain fields | Fields can be of various types (text, number, select, etc.) | . | .

54.title: Template Development
54.content: Prerequisites . | Basic understanding of JSON | Familiarity with JSON Schema | Access to the Template Hub | . Development Process . | Choose appropriate schema type | Define template structure | Add layers and fields | Validate against schema | Test in LabIMotion | Deploy to production | .

55.title: Best Practices
55.content: . | Use meaningful layer and field names | Group related fields in the same layer | Validate templates before deployment | Document custom implementations | Follow naming conventions | .

56.title: Tools and Resources
56.content: . | Template Hub: Browse existing templates | JSON Schema Validator: Validate your templates | GitHub Repository: Source code and examples | .

57.title: Need Help?
57.content: We‚Äôre here to help you with your template development journey: . Email Support GitHub Issues .

68.title: Segment Schema
68.content: A standardized set of metadata properties used to describe Segments in LabIMotion. View JSON Schema View on GitHub .

69.title: Overview
69.content: The Segment Schema provides a contract for the JSON data used in LabIMotion segments, detailing what properties the JSON data should have, their types, and additional constraints.

70.title: Schema Structure
70.content: { "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#", "$id": "https://labimotion.github.io/schema/v1.0/sch-segment.json", "type": "object", "allOf": [ { "$ref": "./include/sch-common-properties.json" }, { "properties": { "layers": { "$ref": "./include/sch-layers.json", "description": "Layers to be used for segment." }, "select_options": { "$ref": "./include/sch-select-options.json", "description": "Select options for segment." } } } ] } .

71.title: Properties
71.content: Common Properties . All Segment objects must include these common properties: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | pkg | Object | Yes | Package information including ELN version | . | uuid | String | Yes | Unique identifier | . | klass | String | Yes | Must be ‚ÄúSegmentKlass‚Äù | . Layer Properties . Segments can have multiple layers, each containing: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | key | String | Yes | Layer identifier | . | cols | Integer | Yes | Number of columns | . | position | Integer | Yes | Layer position | . | fields | Array | No | Array of fields | . | color | String | No | Background color of the layer header | . | label | String | No | Label of the layer | . Select Options . Optional select options for dropdown fields: . | Property | Type | Required | Description | . | desc | String | Yes | Description of the option | . | options | Array | Yes | Array of key-value pairs | .

73.title: Related Schemas
73.content: . | Common Properties Schema | Layers Schema | Select Options Schema | .
